print.title: 2017 survey suggests bullying problems for Mancos High School
print.description: This article did light data journalism to report on local trends found through a statewide student survey. Compared with the rest of the state, results suggest students in the town of Mancos experienced higher rates of bullying and weapons, alongside greater feelings of community connectedness.

print.title: Auditor: Kiva Montessori might not last 12 months
print.description: This was part of a series of articles related to a local montessori [school's](https://the-journal.com/articles/117894-ckms-board-no-evidence-of-asbestos-exposure) [financial](https://the-journal.com/articles/118934-kivas-use-of-emergency-fund-might-be-unconstitutional), [leadership](https://the-journal.com/articles/115305-before-changes-kiva-parents-criticized-school-leadership-for-over-a-year), and [performance](https://the-journal.com/articles/114863-staff-shakeup-low-test-scores-hit-kiva-montessori-school) problems. An independent financial auditor expressed "substantial doubt" that the school would survive another 12 months due to the recent funding crisis.

print.title: Timeline of the Willis impeachment process
print.description: Retrospective coverage of a story about the impeachment of NC State’s Student Body Treasurer after he announced his resignation

print.title: Activism on campus from the student perspective
print.description: I interviewed six NC State students with a reputation for activism and community involvement for the first article in a series about activism at NC State. [Part two](http://www.technicianonline.com/news/article_583d43d0-0a04-11e7-a817-ebc6c833a86a.html) was about faculty and activism, [part three](http://www.technicianonline.com/news/article_bb210f42-1420-11e7-88e6-e7ca771fd926.html) was about the history of activism at NC State.

print.title: Breakdown of the candidates: 2018 Student Body President
print.description: Commentary on the 2018 race for Student Body President and Student Body Vice President, written after the annual, moderated debate by _Technician_

podcast.title: Protected Class: Moses T. Alexander Greene
podcast.publish-info: Published for _The Praeci Podcast_ on February 7, 2018
podcast.description: I spoke with the director of the African American Cultural Center at NC State about common mistakes White people make when talking about Black people and identity. This podcast episode is [nominated for a national collegiate award](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6435915679433580544).

podcast.title: Students first
podcast.publish-info: Published for _The Praeci Podcast_ on November 13, 2017
podcast.description: Edited over 5 hours of interviews and research down to a 73 minute episode on the history of how student and academic affairs at NC State became a part of the same division.

podcast.title: Protected Class: Nashia Whittenburg
podcast.publish-info: Published for _The Praeci Podcast_ on February 14, 2018
podcast.description: The director of Multicultural Student Affairs at NC State talks about her experience growing up in Greenville, South Carolina, and the racial hatred she endured as a young girl.

podcast.title: Title IX in the Trump era
podcast.publish-info: Published for _The Praeci Podcast_ on October 16, 2017
podcast.description: In the first episode of _The Praeci Podcast_, I spoke to Robin Kelley, NC State’s deputy Title IX coordinator, about the history of Title IX, including contemporaneous changes made by Betsy DeVos.
